There is a street crossing so the conductor must blow the horn. It is very loud. The plus side is that you can walk to Little Italy or down to the ocean. There are a couple of convenience stores in the area as well in case you need something.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, highly recommend.”
Reviews.Author: snorkel30
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for two nights prior to leaving on a cruise and we could not have been more pleased. The room rate was very reasonable for the downtown area. We were picked up promptly by their shuttle at the airport. Although we arrived at the hotel before noon, we immediatetly checked-in. From the shuttle driver to the front desk, the staff was very friendly and helpful throughout our stay. The hotel is located near Little Italy, the harbor, the cruise terminal, and two stops on the hop-on-hop-off trolley tour (highly recommended for a good way to see the major sites). The free breakfast was more than adequate for us and certainly an added plus. Our room was a little noisy at night, however, not enough to keep either of us awake. This slight negative was more than offset by the many pluses. We took the hotel shuttle to the cruise terminal, however, we could have walked in about 10 minutes, it's that close. Upon our return our flight was not scheduled until after 5:00 pm and the hotel stored our luggage so we could stay in the area rather than sit at the airport. We would definitely stay at this hotel again and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A2Member
Reviews.Content: For the location and value, I don't think it can be beat. I paid under $100 a night for a king study room which was very spacious. The trolley station is right behind the hotel, so you can get anywhere in San Diego with a 4 day trolley pass that costs only $15. Plus, you can walk almost anywhere. It's about a 25 min walk to the convention center and Gaslamp Quarter - but the trolley goes right there. Plus it is in the heart of Little Italy which has some fantastic Italian restaurants. I do agree with everyone about room location though, you do need to be in the front of the hotel, it is quiet there. Some of my colleagues staying at the Marriott and Hyatt near the convention Center hear the trains from high floors as well. It's just part of some of the hotels in San Diego. Remember, this is not a luxury hotel, but it is clean with good size rooms and a very friendly, accomodating staff. And considering most hotels in San Diego are well over $200 a night, a great value. Plus you get a free breakfast and free internet. Spend that extra money on nice restaurants like Candela's in the Gaslamp Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Very accommodating staff”
Reviews.Author: LITOPA
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights prior to a flight home. The staff recommended two fabulous restaurants and the shuttle bus took us everywhere that we wished to go. Everyone was extremely polite, cheerful and helpful. The room was excellent as always and the pool was a BIG plus after a busy day of sightseeing. Although the Amtrak is a little noisy right behind the hotel, the front rooms are fine. This is a problem along the entire stretch of Pacific Highway regardless of which hotel you choose. Must see: San Diego Zoo, Seaport Village. Places to eat: Top of the Market and Crocce's

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Night Stay, With Super Cool People”
Reviews.Author: Memento54
Reviews.Content: Just another great stay with my lovely Hampton Inn brand... = ) There is just one major negative, and all hotels on Pacific Hwy in downtown are the trains. We stayed in a room which is a corner room that faces the tracks. Hahaha, so it awoke me a few times in the night, but the comfy bed made it a close wash... The hotel itself is a little old but it makes up for it in customer service. Upon check in I didn't get that weird vibe of having to be someone I am not, just the front desk crew made me feel comfortable. They offered plenty of local things to do as well as good local eats. Being in the downtown area it was nice to have a helping hand. Needing to get up early they were able to set me up a few wake up calls, since I usually press the snooze button on the first one. Room was average size with clean linen and the bathroom was nice and had a shower that could fit 3 of me's in it... = 0 Of course soap and all that was included, I also forgot my toothpaste, they deliever it quite quickly. Also included was breakfast and a complementary shuttle to and from the airport!

Reviews.Title: “Be careful”
Reviews.Author: tjs4569
Reviews.Content: I reserved a room for 3 nights and specifically requested a room in the front of the hotel. When I checked in and asked that I be away from the trains in the back and was told my room was. When I got to my room, it opened into a courtyard. I found out that night this courtyard faces the back of the hotel where the trains ran. At 2:25 am I was awoken by the train. The next morning, I asked the manager why I had been put in a room that wasn't away from the trains when I double checked before going to my room. I was told they were having problems with the person who checked me in and apologized and offered to move me to another room. They also offered to not charge me for the first night. When I checked out, they charged me for all three nights. Also, they didn't give me a wakeup call and I nearly missed my flight. The location is great but you must be in the front of the hotel. If you're not, then don't stay here. Check out and go to the Embassy Suites down the PCH towards the convention center.

Reviews.Title: “Will return to this hotel”
Reviews.Author: FamTravAgnt
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location. Walking distance to Little Italy, Maritime Museum, rail. Friendly staff. Great for families. Excellent value. We will stay here on our next trip to San Diego. One word of warning . . . the train runs right behind this hotel and it will wake you in the middle of the night. By our second night we were used to it and went right back to sleep. My son didn't wake up at all.

Reviews.Title: “Like sleeping in a train yard”
Reviews.Author: BDfromDC
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel with a wonderful GM (Sean) and helpful staff but two big flaws: 1. A freight trains goes by between 3am-4:30am every night right behind the hotel blowing it's horn every few seconds, it would wake the dead. If you stay there, you must be in the front of the hotel or plan on being woken up. 2. They have put in those harsh blue-white pig-tale flourescents that are too bright (equal to 120 watts) and too big for the lamps, so the shades are all askew. Unless you like sleeping in hospital rooms, there is a RiteAId nearby that sells normal light bulbs for merely $2.50 EACH.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient but”
Reviews.Author: sameoldg2
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beside a poorly rated mexican drive thru and a bath house and is directly in front of a trolley stop. Its proximity to public transit means two things: you have incredibly easy access to downtown and beyond, and you hear trains all the time. And these trains don't go quietly - they honk their horns and blow their whistles as they go, and yes, you will be awoken by them. The hotel itself isn't the newest in town, but the insides are just fine. The lobby reminds me of a hostel - dorm room quality furniture and lots and lots of fluorescent lighting. The rooms are pretty much what you would expect from a hotel of this class. Breakfast was decent, all things considered. Lots of cereals, yogurt, some fruit, juice, muffins, and a hot item that seemed to vary. The coffee isn't very good. The food itself seems to be in too cramped an area given the number of people eating at peak hours. The free shuttle turned out to not be so convenient - we needed to head to the airport around 10, which happens to be when they run a shuttle to the zoo, and at 10:30 they were taking a group of senior citizens to their cruise (there seem to be a lot of people staying here for this very reason). On a side note, a previous occupant of our room left behind a pair of pants and a shirt which were stuffed behind a chair in the corner of the room. If you stayed here and are missing a whole outfit, you might want to call the hotel! Overall, this place is a great value, but you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay near Little Italy!”
Reviews.Author: Roadtravlr
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hampton Inn for 2 nights to attend the Little Italy Festa. If you are a fan of the Hampton chain and what they offer (free airport shuttles, complimentary breakfast, business traveler-friendly touches) I am happy to report this hotel doesn't break from tradition. Check-in was quick. They get bonus points from me because I arrived around noon and there were a number of people in front of me from the cruise ships--but my room ready and I was able to check in early. The staff was very friendly and very helpful in giving directions. The location was ideal for me since I did not have a car--it's in a safe area, just a quick walk to Little Italy and all the major bus and trolley lines. Also a 5 minute walk to Seaport Village area and the Broadway Pier if you need to catch the ferry to Coronado. I was really impressed by the workout room. While small, it had a number of cardio machines in good shape (including the elliptical--which is hard to find!) and sturdy free weights and a stability ball, and a water cooler. To address the issue of the train--I only heard it once during my stay. But I am used to living near trains so it probably did not bother me for that reason. All in all, a good stay and made my first time visit to San Diego a good one.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Hotel...But Oh That Train Horn”
Reviews.Author: Seanmusik
Reviews.Content: I am a loyal Hampton Inn traveler. I love this brand, and the service they provide. This hotel was no exception. The room was great, the lobby was nice, the staff was wonderful, and the breakfast and location were equally good. The only problem was I couldn't sleep for longer than 10 minutes without being shaken out of bed by the train horns that blow right behind the hotel in the downtown area. If the hotel weren't full during our stay, we would have moved rooms. I realize the train horns blowing is a federal law, and the hotel has no control over this. I would stay at this hotel again, but I would make sure to request a room in the front of the hotel as far away from the train tracks as possible. I am from the city, so I am used to noise, but this was deafening. I would, however recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: hiya891234
Reviews.Content: The rooms are tiny, but very quiet. The hotel is within walking distance of Little Italy, the Midway, and the Seaport Village. Not quite within walking distance of the Gaslamp district - at least for us. Breakfast is decent and the parking fee was smaller than most, so can't really complain. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone who is traveling on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Milwaukee Brewer fans in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: BarbinLAX
Reviews.Content: The room was great. Lots of space with a king bed, couch and chair, refrigerator and microwave. As advertised, the trolly which we took to and from the hotel to see the Brewers vs the Padres, was right behind the hotel. Added plus was the closeness of our hotel to the waterfront. We also took a pilot boat ride and toured the submarine and paddle boat at the pier. Great location for our trip. Hotel staff were always helpful and our room was clean. Paid extra for parking but we knew that in advance. Underground parking was available for a fee.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for comfortable stay on the harbor.”
Reviews.Author: jrw95
Reviews.Content: The Hampton Inn Downtown San Diego was all that we expected it to be. My wife and I are fairly frequent guests at Hampton Inns, and with very few exceptions have been impressed with the consistent quality experience and service. It is not all the bells and whistles of a five star...but for what you pay, it's a good value. We were pleased.

Reviews.Title: “far to close to a train that goes by and honks every 20 minutes”
Reviews.Author: mzphim
Reviews.Content: Clean enough but holy crap it's one a.m. and the train sounds like it's going to come through the wall..... every twenty minutes!!!!!! Rooftop pool is on the second floor but we are on the fifth floor ??? worst hotel ever

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place To Stay in D/T San Diego”
Reviews.Author: YVRTraveller
Reviews.Content: A perfect place to stay in D/T San Diego. Located on Pacific Highway; only about five minutes from San Diego Airport; one block from the waterfront and adjacent to the San Diego Trolley line. The rates are very affordable; though there is a $12 daily parking charge. The parking is an underground garage which is not gated; just an arm. The rooms are basic and very comfortable. Service is top notch and very personable. The free breakfast is okay; nothing to write home about. The business center is one slow computer in the lobby area. Since the hotel is adjacent to train tracks, you will hear the horns of the San Diego Trolley, Amtrak as well as the Coaster commuter trains. The noise is not too bad and did not causing any problems with sleeping. If you are not needing a full service hotel, this hotel is a perfect choice for D/T San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Typical Hampton, but Train Noise an Issue”
Reviews.Author: histfan71
Reviews.Content: I stayed in (and reviewed) this hotel back in 2007. I stayed again this last weekend. Not much has changed since my last review. The hotel was comfortable, clean, and safe but by no means luxurious. It is in a terrific location; the charm and excellent restaurants of Little Italy, the excitement and attractions of the San Diego Bay waterfront, and shopping/dining at Seaport Village are all just steps away from the hotel. This time, however, I had a train noise problem unlike my last two experiences. I was put in room 614 which overlooks the train tracks. As other reviewers said, I heard train noises and horns until midnight. They started up again about seven in the morning. One time a large and heavy freight train passed by at about 11 PM and the room shook so much I thought at first that it was a small earthquake! The only other issue I had was I returned to the hotel from a play at the Old Globe Theatre at about 10:30 PM. The hotel had a "Garage Full" sign up, but I had already paid for parking during my stay. I had to park out in front of the hotel, inform the desk clerk, and the clerk had to move his own car so that I could park. It was great customer service that the clerk moved his own car, but it was still annoying that I had to go through that whole dance, and it should not have been necessary, Also on the plus side was that the front desk staff was very friendly, knowledgeable, and friendly. I asked for some restaurant recommendations and the staff had a whole list of local restaurants, most of which were within walking distance of the hotel. All in all I recommend this hotel, just be sure to ask for a room that is far away from the train tracks!

Reviews.Title: “Actually...better than anticipated!”
Reviews.Author: RotatingGlobe
Reviews.Content: ---Location--- The hotel was easy to get to from the Airport using the Metro Bus 992 (~8-10 min ride). Though, the hotel does offer free shuttle to/from the airport. We only used the shuttle service when we headed back to the airport. If you want to use their shuttle, remember to give them 24-hour advance notice. It was extremely convenient to have the Trolley right behind the hotel (fyi: it is the "County Center/Little Italy" station stop). We used it everyday. Especially coming home at night, it was a savior knowing that we just had to walk down the block and we were 'home'! It isn't the Trolley that's loud, more like the Amtrak that passes by (I do believe) that makes the most sound when it blows it's horn upon passing. Honestly, with the tv and a/c on in the room and being exhausted, you really end up not caring for the noise. It really isn't a big deal. I mean, you do hear it but it's only temporary for a brief moment. At one point, it was so loud (horn) it startled me, but I gruntled a bit and that was it. It passed. No big deal. ---Room--- Since everyone mentioned about the noise since the railroad and Trolley is right behind, I did try to request for a room opposite of the railroad! I got a room on the inner side of the building on the top floor (6th floor). I must say, what I loved most about the room was the nice soft/comfortable King-size bed and the comforter. I slept comfortably. So this makes up for the negative (i.e. noise) for me. ---Amenities--- What I didn't enjoy so much were the bath amenities. The towels were hard to the touch - really, they should consider using fabric softner! Though, luckily, the bath tissue was soft which was a good thing (Angel Soft brand). The other bathroom amenities I didn't enjoy. Using the shampoo made my hair rough. Bar soap as well. The next day I went and bought my own trial size shampoo and bar soap as a consequence. Again, this is no big deal, minor sacrifice! ---Other--- It was great to wake up in the morning to complimentary breakfast. That fueled me well for the day. Free newspaper on the weekdays. Courteous and helpful front desk employees. To me, there are more pros than con staying here so I would definitely return again.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: thetractorman
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week during a convention, and it worked out well for us. It's close enough to walk to the Convention Center, Gaslamp District, Seaport Village, ferries and cruise ship terminal. If you want, you can easily catch the Trolley, or perhaps catch a ride on the hotel coutesy van. The staff was polite and helpful, and we didn't ecxerence any problems. Of course, we were there for the conference and to enjoy the area during off hours, so the hotel wasn't where we spent much time. And as tired as I was by bedtime, I doubt the train noise would have mattered. Like the other reviewers pointed out, this hotel is adjacent to the railroad and the Little Italy trolley stop, so there is a certain amount of noise. We were on the opposite side of the hotel, so we didn't hear it much. We didn't use them, but there is an exercise room and a small pool on the 2nd level. I didn't see a hot tub. My advice: If you want plush accomodations and a quite night, go somewhere else. But, if you want a compromise between convenience, comfort and cost near downtown San Diego, then this is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Not really until they change the system...”
Reviews.Author: DaDivineAngel
Reviews.Content: Well, it seems that the local train system passes the hotel, so it is difficult to have any peace. It is noted that they are working with the city to fix the issue, but right now it's tremendously bad for business. Wireless Internet is not capable, but they do have Internet accessibility. The cable connection is of fair quality. Overall, the room is cozy with nice staff...it is the anemities that are of poor service.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay, work or play.”
Reviews.Author: sailor99Colorado
Reviews.Content: Clean, comfortable, courteous and easy access. Hotel is convenient to downtown and on/off of I-5. Reviews warned about noise, but all downtown hotels will be noisy, so we went with our eyes (and ears) prepared.

Reviews.Title: “I enjoyed the quiet well appointed room and good walk to convention center.”
Reviews.Author: tgl
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a 10 minute ride by their free shuttle from the airport. It is a short block and a half to the marina, and it is on the western edge of Little Italy. The Sicilian Festival was going full swing the weekend that I was there. Check-in in the modest lobby was quick and easy. The staff were consistently friendly and helpful during my four night stay. My room faced the 2nd floor courtyard/pool area. The hotel is adjacent the trolley and train tracks but my room was very quiet. Once, I thought that there was a train passing because of rumbling in the room, but I had all electronics off and was concentrating on a document. I had a comfortable king sized bed and small sitting area with love seat and coffee table. There was a desk and chair with sensible extra plugs for a computer and free internet. There was no safe for the computer in the room. The bathroom was ordinary and fine except that one of the two panels of the shower door was derailed and would not slide to open. Towels were good but not luxurious. There was an iron and board in the closet. The hotel was a 20 to 25 minute walk to the convention center putting it farther than some of the other hotels in its class like the Courtyard Marriott Downtown. However, it was $70 cheaper per night and came with a reasonable breakfast. Breakfast here is not even close to the ridiculously extensive breakfast at the Embassy Suites, but was reasonable with fruit, yogurt, pastries, toast, muffins, sausage and eggs as well as biscuits and gravy. Most of the hot things looked better than they tasted. There were many restaurants within just a few blocks of the hotel as well as a Rite-Aid one block East and one block South. I thought that the hotel was a great value for my conference.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Anniversary Trip”
Reviews.Author: Groupeventplanner
Reviews.Content: Drove down to Hampton Inn for my wedding anniversary. This is were my husband and I stayed for our honeymoon, as well. Because I had indicated in my online reservation that it was my anniversary, we were greeted with "Congratulations" and there was wine and chocolate in our room. Our parking was also comped during our stay. This is a really wonderful hotel. During our trip, we drove to the beach each day, went back to the hotel to rest and refresh, and then walked to Gaslamp for dinner. It was awesome!! This hotel is always our first choice when we visit our favorite city.

Reviews.Title: “What a great experience”
Reviews.Author: oliverBc
Reviews.Content: We had read about noise problems so when we checked in we asked for a quiet room. The room was clean comfortable and just around the corner from the pool. We were in town to cruise with holland america to Hawaii. The hotel shuttle service took us to the restaurant picked us up, took us to the zoo and the Lord Hornblower for a dinner cruise then shuttled us to the ship the next morning. They have a great breakfast included in the price and my husband had chipped beef for the first time. He liked it. Do not hesitate to stay here and if you do tell them Bill and Sandy the Canadians sent you. Our best to Brett at the front desk and Maria one of the shuttle drivers. Awesome people.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap for downtown, but BRING EARPLUGS!”
Reviews.Author: bagjag27
Reviews.Content: Right next to railroad tracks with freight trains going by and blasting their horn at least once per hour. This definitely kept me awake despite wearing earplugs. On the bright side, the breakfast was good and this is walking distance to some good bars and restaurants in the gaslamp as well as the SS Midway and other ships in the harbor.

Reviews.Title: “Too bad about the trains”
Reviews.Author: Nancylovestotravel
Reviews.Content: I hate to complain as the hotel is clean and the staff is wonderful but the trains - oh my god the trains. We were on the 5th floor, looking over the tracks (friends were in the front, still a problem) and could not sleep because of the constant freight trains going by. Every hour, at about 10 past, loud, noisy and blowing their whistles. Then add in the noise of the trolleys going by... Why didn't we leave? The cancellation/early departure fee was too expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, excellent service, warm welcome”
Reviews.Author: SkyTravelPRG
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel DEC 16th-20th. Hotel has good location with close proximity to heart of San Diego and is actually located in Little Italy, on Pacific Hwy in city centre. I appreciate high quality services : 1) warm and friendly welcome 2) complimentary shuttle 3) delicious, rich breakfast 4) nice equipped room 5) business centre with free internet and printer etc. I highly recommend this property.

Reviews.Title: “OK Stay but Beware of Parking Fee”
Reviews.Author: JGMotek
Reviews.Content: Hampton Inns are rapidly becoming my travel hotel of choice: they're usually predictable, clean, and have free wireless (plus *ahem* a 10% AARP discount). This one met all the requirements. One caveat, though: they put a $10 automatic parking fee on the room. They do warn you about this at check-in and I opted out, finding street parking right around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: mavium
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hampton Inn San Diego Downtown during a conference in October 2008. Hotel is located very close to the Star of India, Cruise Ship Terminal, and Anthony's. Parking is $12.00/day and make sure that if you returned your car and no longer need the parking services, inform the front desk such that you will not be charged for this. Free internet in room, OK breakfast, and no microfridge nor microwave in room.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: volatileagent
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel before a cruise and came back for another night after the cruise. The location is close to all amenities and the port. The Hotel is clean, reasonably priced with nice, friendly staff. They provided complimentary internet access and delicious breakfast unlike most others in the area. To avoid the train noise at the back of the hotel, you can ask for rooms closer to the front of the hotel. Will stay at the hotel on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, Comfortable, Clean”
Reviews.Author: Corinne872
Reviews.Content: It has been a very long time since we stayed in San Diego, but I had every intention of writing a review, and 8 months later I'm finally doing it! My husband, our 2 kids, and I arrived a little early (before check-in). The staff was so friendly and helpful. They took our luggage and tagged it for us to pick up later. We also reserved a spot on the complimentary shuttle to the San Diego Zoo for the following day. I asked if there was somewhere nearby to walk and explore. The friendly woman at the desk gave us a map and marked spots for us to visit. We loved walking along the waterfront, stopping for refreshments, and sightseeing. The hotel is in a great location. We spent 3 nights at this hotel (2 nights upon our arrival in California and 1 night before we returned home). The manager was very friendly and down-to-earth. He sincerely wanted to know if we were enjoying our stay. The complimentary breakfast was excellent and enjoyed by all 4 members of our family. The pool was clean (on the roof of the second floor, I believe) and we enjoyed it every evening. The matresses, sheets, and pillows were extra comfortable. The room was clean and stylish, but a little small. We loved the decor and were all very comfortable in the small space. If I ever return to San Diego again, I will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Really..Beware the trains”
Reviews.Author: cc41
Reviews.Content: We were well aware of the warnings and thought that the noise wouldn't bother us but it did. I do not think there is a room that is not affected by the noise and vibration and my husband insists they lean on the horn just a little bit longer at 3am!! Also after dark the area is not well traveled. I wouldn't say we felt unsafe but definately aware of our surroundings. Hotel staff especially breakfast ladies are very pleasant and helpful. Rooms and common areas are very clean. Housekeeping was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, except the train thing”
Reviews.Author: travelerms
Reviews.Content: The service was great, the room was clean and comfortable, the staff was mostly friendly (and those who were not were professional, which is also okay), and it was overall a pretty good experience. The only thing I can really rank this hotel down for was the sometimes startling noise of the train passing behind it, as noted in other reviews. There are earplugs in the bedside drawer! You might need them. I'm a heavy sleeper so once I got to sleep it didn't bother me. The free breakfast was...a free breakfast. Not great but I'm happy with some cereal and a bagel. The breakfast room was crowded on the weekend days, but I was there for a reunion so I was able to find people to sit with every day. Free wireless in the lobby, free wired ethernet in the rooms. They provided an ethernet cable, but we had brought one, so it wasn't an issue anyway. Both worked great--be sure to ask for the access code when you check in. We loved the pool, especially after a warm morning and early afternoon spent walking around San Diego! Plenty of towels available and it's a small pool but it was never crowded. Great town and I was happy with the hotel. I would stay there again. Wish I was back there where it's warm and sunny!

Reviews.Title: “Fine for us, but we knew full well about the trains...”
Reviews.Author: jams33
Reviews.Content: We booked 2 nights at the Hampton Inn with Hilton rewards points. Having been former residents of San Diego, we were full aware of the location - between busy Pacific Highway and the train tracks that services the SD trolley system, commuter rail and the Amtrak. Being aware of the "night train" made this hotel fine for us. But all who plan on staying there should know that the trains are loud, shake the room, run most of the night and regularly honk directly behind the hotel because it is next to a crossing. I am rating this place average not because of the trains but because of the service. First, we waited 40 minutes for the free airport shuttle to retrieve us from the airport despite calling ahead and being assured they would be there just a few minutes after we got our luggage. Knowing the area, we seriously could have walked there quicker. And second, once we arrived at the Hampton Inn, I specifically asked the desk clerk if we were getting a back room (we were checking in late - around 9pm local time and we figured if the hotel was booked we'd probably be in one of the back rooms and right next to the tracks). But instead of saying, "yeah its late and that's all we have left," he said "no, you are very far away from the train tracks." Well, that was a blatant lie because we were in the closest room to the tracks on the 4th floor and had a perfect view of the Beech Street railroad crossing. What was the point in lying? Other than our issues with the service, the hotel was quite nice. The room was clean and spacious. The continental breakfast was plentiful and there was free internet service in the hotel. Although the wireless service was out during our stay, they do have a desktop in the lobby that is there for everyone to use. It also has a printer which is key for printing boarding passes. The location is ok for those looking to visit downtown San Diego but not stay at the expensive hotels in the Gaslamp. It is outside downtown and there are a few restaurants nearby in Little Italy but it is only a 25 minute walk or 5 minute trolley ride to the Gaslamp. So long as you are aware of the noise issue, this is a good hotel for those visiting SD.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay”
Reviews.Author: Micheal67
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel as part of a 1 month tour of California and Florida. Stayed her from June 30th to July 5th. We got collected from the airport by the hotel shuttle which is a very nice gesture, just had to wait about 5 minutes after ringing. On arrival we got the keys to our room and went up only to find it wasn't ready (no big Deal). We rang recepetion who apologised but mentioned a restaurant nearby (voucher maybe) but by the time i carried all the luggage back down again this was not mentioned again. After that start every thing went really great the staff were really friendly and the front desk staff actually got to know us by name. The room was average size with a large bathroom at the front of the hotel but was very comfortable, so no train noise nor traffic as the higway runs by the front but was always very quiet no matter what time of the day it was. The pool area was never busy and great views of close by ships and harbour area. The front desk area and breakfast area and bedrooms were very well maintained and clean. We hired a car for 2 days and went to Carlsbad Outlets (not really worth the visit) and also went to North beach and Old Town which were well worth the visit, it was cloudy the whole time in North Beach but my daughter got really burnt.We also visited Torre Pines golf club as it was just after the US open. The hotel is very close by the Harbour, Seaport Village and the Gaslamp area which has great restaurants and if you walk through the Gaslamp you end up the Convention Center and Petco Park. We stayed over the July 4th Holiday and enjoyed the fireworks, but people actually put up camp all day to watch which in my opinion wasn't really worth it. San Diego is a great city to visit and we really enjoyed our stay at this hotel I would highly recommed this hotel to everyone and hopefully will be back again. After leaving the hotel we proceeded to Anaheim by the Pacific Surfliner train which is a great trip. Will post photos soon

Reviews.Title: “too much dust!”
Reviews.Author: learn2lovethis
Reviews.Content: The area was perfect. close to all the attractions of San Diego we wanted to see. it was right next to 'Little Italy' and they had a great restaurant where we had more than our share of amazing Italian food. the room was nice and clean, we had our water shut off without notice for a while during the day because when we arrived they were renovating. they also had signs warning about the dust but being on a higher floor we didn't think that would bother us. by the second day none of us could breath. I was worried it was my asthma but the other two people on the trip had the same horrible symptoms stuffy nose,very sore throat and puffy eyes. we were a little too nice and didn't complain because we were not in the hotel very often. but another big problem was parking. they had enough parking spaced but they were too small. everyone was double parking and taken up more room than needed to the point where we had to park in a space that we created after complaining to the front office. which was also very friendly and guided us to where we were heading. also the trains didn't bother us that bad, sometimes when it came by around 3am it would but other than that it didn't cause any harm in our vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay - trains didn't bother us”
Reviews.Author: BusinessTravelerUS
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay as part of a conference/family vacation in August '08! We are frequent Hampton Inn guests, as we are a family of three and like the king bed/pull out sofa combo and free breakfast for feeding our hungry son (which includes a protein option good for my diet restrictions.) I'm also a HiltonHonors member. The Hampton Inn was one of the lower cost options for the conference I was attending, and was away from the action for those who prefer the night life of the Gaslight district or ability to walk to the convention center. But conference shuttle service was quicker than from other sites, as we drove along the waterfront rather than through town. We enjoyed the restaurants in Little Italy that you can walk to from the hotel, and the walk to the waterfront, where there are historical ships as part of a museum and modern yachts that have docked for the day to see. The room was very clean and comfortable, and the staff very friendly and helpful. We loved the bed -- while equipped with the fluffy comforter and pillows, the mattress was high quality and firm, which I prefer to some of today's softer beds. I asked for a room on the front side of the hotel after reading the reviews, and there were none available - our room was about 1/2 way between the front (street side) and rear (train side) of the hotel, which ended up being perfect to minimize noise from either. We could still see the train tracks from our window, so I thought the noise would be bad as per the other reviews. While the Amtrack whistle was very loud, we never heard it during the hours that we were sleeping (the last one seemed to be about 10:30 p.m., and the first around 6:30 a.m., which was about our schedule.) And we couldn't hear the trolley at all unless you were trying hard to do so. The trolley access ended up being convenient for my husband and son's excursions during the day. We would definitely stay at this location again - for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Standard Hampton Quality, But Bring Earplugs”
Reviews.Author: backpacker33
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with a friend for just one night before beginning our drive up the Pacific Coast Highway. Good location, easy to get to the airport, and easy to get cabs to go out at night. You can also walk to the bay and see some of the ships docked there. A great place to run/exercise in the morning. The only downside, which has been well documented here is the train/trolley that runs regularly behind the hotel. If you bring earplugs (or ask the hotel for them) you should be OK. I stayed at the hotel in October, 2007 and there was also construction going on next door to the hotel. Our window was slightly open so when the workers started in the morning, it was rather strident. However, with the windows closed, it was bearable. Overall, I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Kind of Disappointing Stay, Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: chrism60
Reviews.Content: This lovely hotel, perfectly located right near the main coastal highway in San Diego suffers from a very uncaring staff. Our room wasn't ready when we arrived, at 4:15pm, well past their "guaranteed" check-in time. They offered us nothing, not even a snack, and just told us to return in about an hour, maybe the room would be ready. We had to ask for access to the parking lot and we had to ask them to give us free parking. They did agree to that, although our bill included it and I had to have it removed. Also the room had 2 doubles, although it was booked as 2 queens. The train noise is very loud, but it did not bother us, since we are hearty sleepers. The breakfast was terrific, much better than expected. We won't be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the location, trains and price!”
Reviews.Author: Wishteller
Reviews.Content: Yes, it is right next to the train tracks and you can hear the trains, but you know what, for the location, price and ambience, you can't beat it. We could hear the trains and I thought it was kind of cool, there are regular passenger and freight trains and the local trolley. The back rooms are right on the tracks, the rooms facing west face the street. We stayed there for the annual Comic-Com comic book convention and frankly I was afraid of the price, $169 per night, but other hotels - dives, psudo Motel 6's with bars on all the windows - were going for the same price or more all along the block, and other hotels, the Holiday Inn across the street, the Marriott, the Hard Rock were $250+ and more. The hotel looked just like it did on the website, sorry no pics of my own, but the lobby is very airy, it can be described as art-deco or upscale Ikea, the rooms were great. I've stayed in 3 Hiltons in the past year and the rooms at this Hampton Inn were comparable in every way, just a little smaller. The beds had the "Cloud Nine" description which is a great big (clean) fluffy comforter with cover, sheets, fluffy pillows and lap desk. TV in armoire, clock radio, two phones, coffeemaker in the bathroom, the usual, but it was all nice. Hotel cons - got stuck in the elevator on our first day there. The emergency phone calls the front desk and the clerk hung up on us twice because we think she couldn't hear us. Hotel pros - free breakfast! This in itself was worth it! Breakfast was 2 hot dishes (our stay = eggs and sausage), various pastries and bagels to toast on your own, a selection of juices, whole fruit and fruit salad, cold cereal, instant oatmeal, milk, coffee, tea hot chocolate and yougurt. All day long there is coffee and tea service in the dining area as well as whole fruit (oranges, bananas and apples for us). Eat a BIG breakfast, grab some fruit and you can make it through most of a convention and grab dinner later on. The website advertised breakfast to go, but no one said anything to folks talking food up to their rooms or stopping by on the way out. Other Pros - transportation - the hotel again is right on a trolley/train line. The trolley stop is right behind the hotel and there are 2 ticket machines there. Two blocks south is the Santa Fe/American Plaza station which is a transfer point for the trolley as well as the Amtrak and Surfliner local trains - you can walk there easily as well. Across the street is the Holiday Inn and the waterfront. For our stay the Holiday Inn was also a shuttle stop for Comic-Con, but the hotel is an easy 15 minute walk I think. It wasn't that far in my mind at all and I don't walk much, on a map it looked really far but it wasn't. Food - the hotel is right next to a taco stand that's open early and late, and 100 feet away is a Jack in the Box. If you go behind the hotel and up the hill is an area called "Little Italy" and the clerk at the hotel told us nothing about it when we asked for a place to eat, but it was wonderful! There are pricey and moderate cafes, restaurants and chains coffee shops, but we ate Filippi's - a great old-style place with wine bottles hanging from the ceiling, employees eating on their breaks right next to the customers and great CHEAP food! Ask for the waitress Irene, she's fun and tell her the bingo girls wrote about her on the internet. The place is full of character and good food. For some the area around the hotel may be iffy, there are those low budget, in my mind "scary" hotels a few blocks down - 1 block north is a Courtyard by Marriott, then 2 scary hotels, then what looked like an industrial area. 1 block east, not even a block, was the trolley stop and 2 blocks east was Little Italy. 1 block west was the waterfront, and to the south were the main train station and city center-ish area, so for us it was ok walking around after 11pm, but again there were 100,000 people in town too, lots of taxis, pedi-cabs, etc. so just use common sense. I noticed a room being cleaned had a microwave and mini-fridge, you can probably ask for that at check-in. There is a 7-11 if you go out the front door of the hotel, make a right then make a right. In that neighborhood, alcohol sales stop at 10pm I think. But Filippi's sells 6-packs to go too! You need your hotel key to get into the ice and vending areas on your floor. Parking is $12 a day with in and out privileges and it is added to your bill at the end. You need your key to get into the parking lot - underground, 3 stories and TIGHT if you get in late - and you need your key to get in the elevator from the parking lot. On our last day, we packed up the car, checked out and left our car there until we were done at the convention, caught a trolley back, got our car and left. Not sure if that was Kosher, but it worked for us and saves us parking fees. I'm trying to book my stay for next year's Comic-Con again now! Oh, if you book through the convention, they do use this hotel at about the same rate we paid but with a harsher cancellation policy, 72 hours I think, and with our booking directly through the hotel it was 48 hours and no credit card deposit - I'm a HiltonHonors member though so don't know if that helped. Oh and free daily paper, or almost daily, frree wi-fi in the lobby, free internet in the rooms, and they have a shuttle too! Ok, and this may sound funny, but I think they steam or poach their eggs in a microwave, so they look really bright yellow and white, someone said like Play-Doh food, LOL, but they tasted fine!

Reviews.Title: “Trains too much!”
Reviews.Author: attytravel
Reviews.Content: I found this property to have the typically nice quality and service I expect from a Hampton Inn. However, railroad and trolley tracks are directly behind the hotel. You constantly hear the crossing gate bells, the trains themselves, and worst of all, the train whistles. This was very distracting when trying to work and completely interfered with sleeping (I think there was stretch of between 2 am and 4 am when the trains weren't running). This is a lesson for me to always read TripAdvisor reviews (train problem discussed in other reviews), even for hotel chains I am familiar with.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints here!”
Reviews.Author: jinaz
Reviews.Content: Very pleasant stay; comfy bed, clean, great b-fast, yes, there is a train behind the hotel but it didn't really bother us (note: we have a sound conditioner); location very convenient for the trolley and Little Italy and last but not least very clean garage with elevators that take you directly to your floor.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectations, but the TRAINS!”
Reviews.Author: SaraSuzy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here while he was in town for work. We got one of the newly renovated rooms on the 6th floor and it was fantastic...comfy bed, nice large bathroom with good amenities, a pull out sofa, tons of extra space, and kept very clean. The staff at this hotel is out of this world. I would compare them to the Four Seasons...that is how good they are. Everyone from the front desk staff to the breakfast attendant went out of their way any time we asked for something. The breakfast was good...not fantastic, but met expectations. The lobby/common areas are nice and newly renovated. However, this hotel has a serious problem with those trains. They are SO loud. Thankfully they did not wake us at night, but they are frequent and LOUD. The hotel is obviously aware of the problem and apparently are working out a deal with Amtrak. They left us a white-noise machine in our room as well as ear plugs without any prompting, and the white-noise really helped. Do not pay the $12 for parking unless you just have to have the convenience. There are plenty of metered spots and free spots around the hotel if you are willing to walk/search/have change on you. All in all, I would highly recommend this place if they can figure out the train nightmare.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Location and Pool”
Reviews.Author: ARKSugarLand
Reviews.Content: I was in town for the BIO 2008 conference and moved here from another hotel (Bristol-see review). I lucked out on them having a room as the city was full. Here is what is odd. I liked this hotel despite the trains and rather plebian decor (light white oak pressboard....with plastic chrome strip). It was the staff and their friendliness. And despite the fact the hotel rooms were BORING, it was super clean and that matters a lot. Breakfast was fine- I mean it is free, how can you go wrong? Free shuttle around town if you ask and he is free. Again, a plus. Pool was absolutely beautiful- overlooking the harbor and nobody was ever in it///how NICE! Adequate but small fitness center. Anyway-take a chance on this place-I am glad I did.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Good Parking, Expensive, TRAINS!!!!”
Reviews.Author: mkramer27
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hampton Inn (Downtown) San Diego, CA for two nights last week while traveling on business. The hotel is under renovation but it's really not too much of an inconvenience. I stayed in one of the recently upgraded rooms on the top floor (6th) which was very nice. The hotel (along with all other hotels in the area) is near the train tracks. You WILL hear the trains. The hotel knows this and leaves ear-plugs on your pillows instead of chocolates. I had no problems sleeping though so they must stop running the trains in the evening. There is a parking garage directly underneath the building and they charge 12 dollars a day for it but it's convenient and safe/clean. The cost was $189 per night and I think they wanted even more than that initially. This seems a bit high for what you get. It was tough making reservations so make them early. I think part of this issue is due to the renovations they're going through.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff- trains not too bad”
Reviews.Author: scscientist
Reviews.Content: Other trip advisor reviews warned that trains passed directly behind the hotel and were noisy. This is true, but it was not as bad as I suspected and in fact never woke us up, or disturbed us in hotel sleeping, intenet acess etc. The staff and the hotel shuttle service was great . Staff always willing to provide advice and when I asked for rooms close to the front of the hotel when I chechked in - to mitigate train noise -a tip I picked up from previous Trip Advisor reviews - they accomodated . Breakfast was as good as it gets in those hotels who provide it in the lobby as part of the room price The van took us to Balboa Park (zoo, Museums etc) and was efficient from the airport. We left early morning before shuttle service started and staff arranged taxis. Great location - on trolley line ( the same tracks where the trains run) , near many restuarants (Little Italy and Waterfront)., downtown etc. Overall a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Won't stay there again”
Reviews.Author: MS624
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent traveler to Hampton Inn hotels. The rooms at this hotel are average. I have stayed at much nicer Hampton Inns. They always have a great complimentary breakfast. The location is great, which is why I chose the hotel. However, the trains are horrible at this hotel. They run right next to the hotel. And they do not stop at 10:30. There are several at 2 and 3am. The train is required to sound its horn at every street crossing through downtown San Diego. I requested a room towards the front of the hotel to get further away from the tracks. Well, I was put on the north side of the hotel, now I had train noise and airplane noise from the airport. I was exhausted from the lack of sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Trains”
Reviews.Author: ElaineT1
Reviews.Content: Great location fro cruise ships. Great staff Good breakfast Nice rooms Trains running all night within feet of hotel. Front desk told me they stopped at 10.30 - no such luck. NO SLEEP even with earplugs???????? Got a small discount, but the "not satisfied - you don't pay garantee" did not offer any refund?

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for pre-cruise”
Reviews.Author: dmlee90
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hampton Inn San Diego Downtown for a one-night stay before our Mexican Riviera cruise. It is about 2 blocks from the cruise terminal. It also has a complimentary shuttle from the airport and to the cruise terminal. The front desk staff was very friendly and helpful. Unfortunately, we were unable to get a room at the front of the hotel, but the trains really didn't bother us much. During the day and early evening hours the train does go by often, but we didn't notice any train traffic in the middle of the night. Unless you go to bed very early (like 8 p.m.) or get up late (9:00 a.m.) the train won't bother you. We went to bed at 11:00 p.m. and got up at 7 a.m. The complimentary breakfast was a nice touch. There is a different hot menu item every day. On the day we had breakfast here, there were hot biscuits and gravy, along with danish, muffins, cereals, fresh fruit, yogurt, coffee and juice. The day before, there was french toast and sausage. They also have fresh baked cookies at the front desk in the evening. The rooms were very clean with a fairly large bathroom......at least it was larger than many of the other hotels that I've stayed at. The beds were very comfortable with nice bed comforters. This is not 5 star hotel, but a very nice hotel for a good price for a pre-cruise stay. Little Italy is about 3 blocks away with some great restaurants nearby. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: hmbfox
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a weekend in San Diego. We stayed at the Hampton Inn and found it to be great in most ways. Yes, there is the train at night but we were not bothered by it. The location is fabulous, VERY nice and accomodating front desk staff, clean, comfortable rooms with amenities and breakfast! All for a very righteous price- we would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, great location”
Reviews.Author: loopsngeorge
Reviews.Content: Read all the reviews and I see what people mean about the train noise, although it did not bother us particularly. It's the horn sounding (repeatedly!) rather than any noise of the train moving on the tracks. Everything else about the hotel is great - the room was very comfortable and modern and the location was perfect for visiting everything on the bay and getting over to Point Loma, Shelter Island etc. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad hotel”
Reviews.Author: ianst
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights Sept 07, good location, helpful staff, internet was useful. breakfast was ok, but I am a fussy eater. Good price for the location, did not notice any noise problems.

Reviews.Title: “Misery of constant train NOISE!”
Reviews.Author: CaliPalosVerdes
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located adjacent to the railroad and trolley tracks on Pacific Hwy. As a result, we spent 3 sleepless nights of noise there in December. Adding to our discomfort was the primitive heating system without a thermostat. When it was on, it blew constant hot, dry air. When it was off, it was too cold to be comfortable. There were other hotels located adjacent to the tracks. Thus, it's advisable when booking a hotel in downtown San Diego to avoid accommodations on Pacific Hwy.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed our stay at this Hampton...”
Reviews.Author: johnandbilldc
Reviews.Content: We actually enjoyed our 8-day stay in this Hampton Inn. We really enjoyed the comforts that this hotel provided such as: - free breakfast (which was actually a really good spread and not just a continental style) - warm cookies in the evening (YUM!) - movie channels - free high-speed internet - very friendly and accomodating staff - in-room refrigerator - complimentary shuttle that will drive to various places downtown We were in San Diego for some business training, so staying at this location was just right. LIttle Italy was just around the corner and harbor drive was just a block away. We were able to run up and down harbor drive to Seaport Village in the evenings. For anyone needing extreme quiet, try to get a room away from the back, which is closest to the train track. The hotel staff is very accomodating, so they will move you if you want. If you're there just for a night, the train is actually interesting and unique to hear.

Reviews.Title: “great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: fitubolla
Reviews.Content: Shared a room with two colleagues when in San Diego for a conference. Staff was friendly and helpful, safety box was free, luggage storage free, room was clean and large. Bathtub had a jaccuzi function. We were on the third floor, so no disturbance from traffic. We booked this hotel because of the breakfast that is included in the room fee. It was great, a buffe with lots of different things to suit most tastes. Three kinds of coffee. :) The blue tram line stops right behind the hotel. I am not sure about the price as it was paid by my employer, but I would definitely recommend this hotel. I would put "excellent" if I knew more about the price. :)

Reviews.Title: “one negative, lots of positives”
Reviews.Author: DrGoldin
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed this hotel because of the many advantages: It's a very short drive to the airport, and the hotel has a complimentary shuttle. The hotel is in a great area, minutes from the water and minutes from great restaurants in Little Italy. The staff is very friendly and helpful. There's cabled AND wireless internet in the room. Breakfast is fine, typical Hampton Inn style. The one negative: it's RIGHT up against the train tracks, and if you're in the wrong room, the noise can be pretty loud. Train noise doesn't bother me very much, but I'm sure it could annoy light sleepers. All in all, I'd stay here again, it was a lovely stay, but if you think the trains will irritate you, find someplace closer to the harbor.

Reviews.Title: “Room was nice. Noise was loud.”
Reviews.Author: lcosette
Reviews.Content: My stay in the Hampton Inn would have been nice, minus the noise. The room was spacious and clean, the bathroom wasn't bad. The bed was very comfortable, and parking wasn't expensive -$12/day. Plus, there was free internet access. The biggest problem with the hotel is the noise from the trains. I was aware of the trains before I booked the hotel, but as i was in town for a conference, I had limited hotel options. However, the noise isn't noted anywhere on Hampton Inn's website, and even the people at the front desk seemed to be trying to cover up the trains when I asked them for a room at the front of the hotel (which I got, but it didn't help much). The trains aren't bad during the day, but if you want to get a full night's sleep past around 5:30am, don't count on it because they will wake you up. Additionally, there was a cruise ship across the street at the harbor one day that blew it's horn very loudly every so often as well. So, I would stay here if I had no other option but I would definitely look elsewhere first!

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: Sabafaisal
Reviews.Content: It was a great experience for us. The location is perfect. The trolley stop is behind the hotel which is very convenient for travellers. The train sounds didn't bother us. The room was very comfortable and very clean. The breakfast was good. Overall a very good experience. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Served it's purpose”
Reviews.Author: Atlanta_Love2Travel
Reviews.Content: Great location, near the waterfront! We could see a cruise ship from our front window so if you're taking a cruise this is walking distance from the terminal. Yes, it is an older hotel and a little noisy but the price is good, the room was clean and the staff was great! The internet to print our boarding passes was also helpful. They also have a free shuttle to the airport. We would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Staying at the Train Station”
Reviews.Author: quiglyupover
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at many Hampton Inns and have never been disappointed until now. First of all this is an old property and had a depressing interior. But, that is not the worst thing about this hotel. There are four busy train tracks next to the hotel. All four tracks are busy throughout the day, and night. I should have known something was wrong when I arrived in my room and there were two pairs of ear plugs on the nightstand. If I would have used them, it would have not been enough. The trains are LOUD!!! You would think that the trains and noise would slow down late at night, but no. The trains come by every 10 or 15 minutes until about midnight and then arrive every 30 minutes until 6:00 am when they increase in frequency. The ringing barricades for the streets can be heard with every train. The guys driving the trains must delight in sounding the horns as much as possible. I paid $131 for one night and checked out as soon as possible the next morning. I checked in to the Hilton Resort at Torey Pines, about 20 minutes away and it was one of the nicest properties I have stayed at, and it was the same rate at $131.

Reviews.Title: “A great bargain for downtown”
Reviews.Author: graveljack
Reviews.Content: First the good parts. You will not find a better central location for seeing the sites in and around San Diego. The hotel is located approx. 3 miles from the airport, one street over from the water front. Compared to the hotels within a two mile area the Hampton offered the best prices by far. The hotel itself is spartan but functional. The rooms were standard hotel size and clean. The beds were extremely comfortable and the bathroom was well stocked and clean. Housekeeping was prompt and thorough. One of the things I liked is that you could open the windows and take advantage of the breeze off the water. The morning breakfast was average but provided the protien to start the day and get you to lunch. As stated in previous reviews there is ample parking but it is tight. With a little manuevering you should have no problem. Check in took about 5 minutes and check out was automatic. The hotel provides a computer with printer (no charge) to print your airline boarding passes. You can also use it to check the internet for information on any sights you might plan on seeing. Across the street is the Embarcadaro (sp) which is the city's tourist waterfront. You are within two blocks of the Maritime Museum, six blocks of the Midway Museum (fantastic tour) and about ten blocks from Seaport Village's quaint shops. They have a Crazy Shirt shop and several restaurants. For dinner one only has to walk out the front door, turn right and head two blocks up the street to Little Italy. There you will find approx. two blocks of very nice restaurants. Be sure to eat at Phillipes Pizza Grotto. they have one of the few parking lots but get there early. We arrived at 4 PM and when we left about an hour later there were approx. 20 people waiting to get in. Price's are local and not touristy. And this was on a Tuesday afternoon. Heading back to the hotel you will pass a 7-11 where you can buy your Cheetos for an evening snack. If you like Mexican there is a locals taco stand next door. If you don't choose to sitesee by rental car the City Trolley is directly behind the hotel. This is one of the best kept tourist secrets and takes you almost anywhere you may want to go. The Trolley runs all the way from Old town and the Fashion Mall to the Gaslight area. You may want to try the Commercial Tourist Trolley also as it goes to all the tourist attractions including Coronado. All in all we found the Hampton Inn to be the ideal location for seeing San Diego and saving a few bucks. Now the bad, the trains. Yes they are loud. Thank goodness I'm a train lover or I might have been upset over our location in the hotel. We were on the interior courtyard which acted just like an amphitheatre. With the windows closed they were a noticable nucense. With the window open they were LOUD. A pair of earplugs would do the trick, which I had, or you could come back later in the evening as they seemed to stop about 9 PM. I would suggest asking for a room on the outside or at the front of the hotel. Anyway, we kept remarking about what a great location we had every time we returned to the hotel. Hope this review helped.

Reviews.Title: “Hampton Inn Downtown San Diego”
Reviews.Author: troubled1
Reviews.Content: I stayed here one nite, very nice and clean, Hall ways were hot, Room was nice and clean, but small. The train runs behind the Hotel until 10p, so that was tolerateable, The plus was being able to walk a 2 blocks to the ocean and the Star of India (Ship) I think $160 was a little steep, but if you want to be close to the action, this is the place to stay, Checked out early so I didnt get a chance to try the breakfast, I Will add that I noticed someone from security that walked the halls at 6p and at 4a so that makes me feel like they were wanting to keeps the guests safe. I will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: esdoc
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hampton Inn for a week while visiting family in San Diego. The service was excellent: If we needed extra towels etc., the response was immediate. The complimentary breakfast was very good, a nice variety of hot and cold choices. The location was fantastic and the rooms were very clean and a good size. The hotel does run parallel to a train station, and the train whistles can be very loud at night. Fortunately for us, we just slept through them. Next time, I would request a room at the front of the hotel. All in all, we were very satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “It was ok”
Reviews.Author: memberat
Reviews.Content: Let's start with the good. The location is good, we like this part of San Diego. The staff is very nice and helpful. The trains didn't really bother us like they did for some others. We heard them in the evening the early night, but they never woke us. As for what is in the middle, neither great nor horrible, I'd say the breakfast qualifies. It is breakfast, but I wouldn't call it particularly delicious by any means; rather fuel for the morning. Now for the bad. The furniture was rather worn in the room, particularly the coffee table; really could use replacing. And finally, the parking was horrible. Although we were able to park each night in the garage, for which you pay and that's ok, the spaces were terribly small. One morning it took a 25 point turn to get my car out of it's spot.

Reviews.Title: “Great Pre-Cruise Hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelbanana
Reviews.Content: We stayed here before our Holland America Cruise. The shuttle picked us up at the airport and then took us to the ship the next morning. There was 5 of us so we had a lot of luggage!!! We had two rooms one facing the courtyard and the other in front facing the bay. Both rooms were clean and beds were very comfortable. All the staff was very friendly nad helpful. It is walking distance to the waterfront and a few blocks from the mall. We took the trolley downtown just to sightsee. The breakfast had very good variety and was kept well stocked and clean. For the price it was better than any other hotel in this area. We saw our ship come in on Saturday morning. We didn't notice any of the noise that others complained about but then again I requested rooms close to the front of the hotel. I have recommended this hotel to quite a few people and they all enjoyed it as much as we did.

Reviews.Title: “2x staying; this x for 3 days!”
Reviews.Author: TomSwyr
Reviews.Content: If not for this location being easily in view of the San Diego Harbor --- this would be just another average hotel. If not for this train whistling noise this time - I would have given excellent. Our first room assignment we were given room 417 facing the train tracks. I immediately requested a change in room to facing the "courtyard". THE COURTYARD IS NOT THE SWIMMING POOL! Even facing the courtyard in Room 447, we still could hear the noise though not sooo loud in 417. We were awaken a few nights soon after 1:00 am and as early as 5:00 am. In our case, we were gone out of the room most of day anyway, and by time we got back at 9 pm, we were all soo totally exhausted anyway. If you stay here, you need to request ROOMS 401, 402, 403, 404, 405 otherwise, request a room FACING THE SWIMMING POOL! The staff was helpful and the Hampton Inn breakfast area was to expected - nothing spectacular but satisfiying. There were at least 3 Hampton Inn staff handling the breakfast replinishments and rotations. Be forewarned , after 7:30 a.m., it is a free-for-all for food, orange juice, milk, etc. In general people will begin to grab anything and everything to eat and drink. THere is a hotel computer terminal in the corner to access the world-wide web. The problem is just waiting on somebody to read their jokes and funny pictures.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Kazzz
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights on our Honeymoon. Extremely helpful staff. Great location. Within walking distance of Seaport Village (which is sooo beautiful). The trolley was right behind the Hotel which was great for us as we didn't feel comfortable driving on the other side of the road... so we were able to catch the trolley around town. This was a really cheap and easy alternative for us to see the City. Free Shuttle Bus to pick us up from Airport and drop us back was a nice touch. Huge Hotel room. Breakfast was average. Free internet use (in lobby) was also a nice added extra.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Darbydacat
Reviews.Content: The Hampton Inn downtown was great. the staff is so friendly and helpful. the hotel is in a great location, especially if you love italian food. it's a block or two from little italy which has fabulous restaurants. the parking was only $14 and we never had trouble finding a spot. the hotel however was not sold out. the rooms are spacious and clean. bathrooms are large and clean. the hallways are in great shape and the carpet is clean throughout the property. breakfast was more than adequate with eggs, sausage and gravy, bagels, toast, cereal, yogurt and fruit and juices. you can hear the trains. the first time we stayed we were in room 330 a whirlpool room near the front of the hotel. i never heard the train past midnight. the second time we stayed in the very back right next to the tracks in room 315. it was louder but again we were not bothered at all by the noise. it was way more important to us to be in a friendly, convenient, CLEAN hotel! i do not have one complaint abou this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A great one night stay”
Reviews.Author: jp_1674
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here for one night and we could not have been more pleased. There is a young guy named Lorenzo who works at the front desk. If you have any problems at this hotel speak to Lorenzo. If he worked for me, I would give him a raise immediately, and this hotel should also. The hotel is very modern, seemed brand new and very nicely appointed. The free breakfast in the morning was great also. What was excellent about this hotel, and I stress excellent, was the customer service that was extended to me. I had to drop off my rental car to the airport. Lorenzo at the front desk kept telling me, no problem, just give us a call, we'll pick you up at the car rental place. Whenever anyone is that sure of themselves, I absolutely lose all faith. Well lo and behold, I called from the rental car return, they said they would be there in ten minutes, and ten minutes later, the hotel van was right there to pick me up. Outstanding customer service. And the same holds true for the morning when they dropped us off at the airport, everything went according to plan just as promised. As for the train noise, forget it, it is non-existent. My four year old loves trains and we could not hear one at all. It is my opinion that the people who complain about the train noise at this hotel are people who just like to complain. Accommodations were just great at this hotel. Behind the hotel is the little italy section of San Diego. Ask about a place called Filippi's Pizza grotto, it was really great. I would absolutely stay here again next time in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Trip to USS Midway”
Reviews.Author: viking644
Reviews.Content: I was booked into this hotel as one of my staff was participating in a graduation on the USS Midway museum. It was only 1/2 mile from the Midway, thus within walking distance to the event. The room was very good with a comfortable king bed & jacuzzi tub/shower. The problem with this hotel, and all hotels on Pacific Hwy in downtown are the trains. We stayed in room 230 which is a corner room that faces the roadway. Even in this room which is as far as one could be from the tracks which are on the east side of the hotel, the train horns were very distrubing. It is a shame as the hotel is well taken care of and convenient-just noisy (all night long). Take ear plugs. The parking garage is cramped for full sized vehicles. Take care in parking.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Clean, but Noisy”
Reviews.Author: Happy0nes
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel because it was centrally located near the USMC Recruit Depot, Seaport Village and Balboa Park. Our 6th floor (top floor) room was on the north side of the hotel with a view of the train tracks. Our room was very clean and comfortable. The only problem was the close proximity to the train station. The trains sounded their horms as they arrived throughout the night, which kept waking us up. There was also a lot of airplane noise, as the hotel is close to San Diego airport. If we visited this area of San Diegp again, we would probably stay at the Holiday Inn on the Bay, which is a couple of blocks closer to the bay and farther from the train station.

Reviews.Title: “I've always been a skeptic, but.......”
Reviews.Author: quigleyMinnesota
Reviews.Content: The Hampton Downtown is a great place to stay, not only for the value but the service is excellent. We are always skeptical when we read reviews and so that is why I decided that I needed to provide input on this hotel because we had a very positive experience. First of all, the hotel is a price value considering it is within walking distance to the cruise ships, restaurants, the ocean, etc etc. The rooms are very nice and well maintained. The staff is excellent. Their shuttle service is VERY accommodating and the breakfast buffet is "yummie". Not only did the staff go out of their way for us during our stay but they allowed us to store our luggage on our return from the cruise week. Our flight didn't leave San Diego until 6PM. We got off the cruise ship around 9:30 am and the hotel picked us up, stored our luggage while we toured San Diego for the day, and then drove us to the airport. We were very impressed and will DEFINITELY stay there again when we return to San Diego. P.S. Yes the train does come through the area but it really isn't as bad as some have reported in the reviews. We were on vacation and a little noise from a train wasn't going to bother us. The positive to this is that you can go all over San Diego from the train shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “Trains are heard from everywhere”
Reviews.Author: travelsmartnj
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hampton Inn one night pre-cruise. Location was excellent with free shuttles from the airport and to the port. Having read about the train noise on trip advisor I requested a room away from the trains. Although we were not directly facing them you could see and hear them from our room. When I went down to the front desk they offered to switch my room but said you can hear the trains from all the rooms-some more than others. For one day it was fine but I wouldn't stay there for longer

Reviews.Title: “Cheap price but not as clean as I would like”
Reviews.Author: mwm308
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hampton Inn San Diego Downtown. The nightly cost was resonable for the area but the hotel has some areas to work on. The front desk staff seamed very lax for a Hilton property. On a positive note, the free morning breakfast was excellent with a fair amount of options. The main draw back was the lack of cleanliness of the rooms. The bathroom was yuck.... and the bed mat was looking pretty rough. Another draw back is the windows didnt seem to block out much noise. There is a train that runs very close to the hotel and It was very annoying in the evening. I wouldnt say I would not stay there again, I would just hope that the next room was handled much better.

Reviews.Title: “Good Overall”
Reviews.Author: OC-Lynch
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went on a dinner cruise and stayed at the Hampton Inn for one night. We chose the Hampton because of its proximity to the ship terminal and its price. Despite all the horror stories we read about the trains, we decided to give it a shot. We followed the suggestions and requested a room in the front of the hotel. Our request was honored, but we were at the left corner of the hotel and could see the tracks from our window. I do have to mention that neither of us heard the trains during the night and my husband is a light sleeper. We started hearing them around 7 a.m. the next morning. All I can say about the trains is Wow! I could not believe how loud they are. The hotel itself is very clean and well maintained. Our room was very spacious and well stocked with towels and pillows. The bed was very comfortable. Although the trains didnâ€™t interrupt our sleep, it makes me cautious to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel near the Water and the train”
Reviews.Author: IVernazza
Reviews.Content: Made a reservation through Expedia but the hotel had no record of it. The employees were very nice and sorted out the problems with Expedia and honored my resevation. Very unlikely I will use Expedia again. As for the hotel, it is an older Hampton Inn but it was clean with comfortable beds (two queen beds in the room). The drawback is if you are a light to medium sleeper, there is a train and trolly that roll past the Hotel until about 1:00 am then start up around 6:30 am., and when I say roll past, the train tracks border the east side of the hotel property!!!!The hotel will provide ear plugs. The hotel should consider replacing the old windows with more soundproof ones. No one in my group was bothered by the noise. Several hotels in this area are along the train tracks, Hampton Inn is no exception. The breakfast was OK, eggs are not scrambled but folded (??), no potatoes, sausage or bacon, but fruit and bagels. I did come near the end so there were no pastries, etc. No restaurant on the premises, but there is a menu in the room for a nearby restaurant that will deliver. The hotel has nice pool (small as hotels go) and you can see the bay from the pool area. They do charge $10 a day for parking. Within walking distance to the embaradero and a $7 taxi (for three) to the Gaslamp quarter. You spend little time in the room. If you want something closer to Gaslamp, be prepared to spend $100 extra per night. I would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Stop your whining - this place is awesome!”
Reviews.Author: gwalt
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews complaining about train noise, I was somewhat nervous, having a room right on the tracks. If you are an afternoon napper, this may be a problem. The bigger problem would be with all the incredible things to do within 5 miles of this hotel, choosing to nap! In the napper's favor, the beds are so irresistably comfortable, I can see one easily suffering from "bed glue". Down comforters and satiny soft sheets - yum. Fortunately, at night the trains also go to bed. The night I stayed, there was a military ball ensuing, and many of these fine boys were also guests at the hotel. A few inebrieted fellows decided the fire alarm would be amusing at 1:30 a.m. Fortunately, it was obviously a false alarm, and quiet was quickly re-established. In the morning, we woke to find a very apologetic letter under our door explaining what had happened, and how they addressed the problem - those silly boys traded in the best beds in town for a jail cell! Breakfast was above average for these hotels - a real bonus was fresh fruit and yogurt, and the muffins really were baked that morning. And really good coffee! Don't let other reviews scare you off - this hotel is perfect for everything San Diego has to offer!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Odysseus17
Reviews.Content: As a Hilton Honors member, I have stayed at several Hampton Inns across the country, and this was probably the worst experience I have had. The hotel itself is located right next to the train tracks, so the noise from passing trolleys is very significant. The carpet in my room was in very poor condition.
